com.bigdata.rdf.sail.webapp.client

Class RemoteRepository

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.bigdata.rdf.sail.webapp.client.RemoteRepositoryDecls
      • com.bigdata.rdf.sail.webapp.client.RemoteRepositoryBase
        • com.bigdata.rdf.sail.webapp.client.RemoteRepository

  • public class RemoteRepository
extends RemoteRepositoryBase
    Java API to the Nano Sparql Server.

    Note: The RemoteRepository object SHOULD be reused for multiple operations against the same end point.

    See Also:
    NanoSparqlServer REST API , Create a bigdata-client jar for the NSS REST API

      • hasStatement

        public boolean hasStatement(org.openrdf.model.Resource s,
                   org.openrdf.model.URI p,
                   org.openrdf.model.Value o,
                   boolean includeInferred,
                   org.openrdf.model.Resource... c)
                     throws Exception
        Method to line up with the Sesame interface.
        Parameters:
        s - The subject (optional).
        p - The predicate (optional).
        o - The value (optional).
        includeInferred - when true inferred statements will also be considered.
        c - The contexts (optional, BUT may not be a null Resource[]).
        Returns:
        true iff a statement exists that matches the request.
        Throws:
        Exception
        See Also:
        hasStatements can overestimate and ignores includeInferred (REST API) , Resource... contexts not encoded/decoded according to openrdf semantics (REST API)

      • rangeCount

        public long rangeCount(org.openrdf.model.Resource s,
              org.openrdf.model.URI p,

              org.openrdf.model.Resource... c)
                throws Exception
        Perform a fast range count on the statement indices for a given triple (quad) pattern.
        Parameters:
        s - the subject (can be null)
        p - the predicate (can be null)

        c - the context (can be null)
        Returns:
        the range count
        Throws:
        Exception
        See Also:
        Add REST API method for exact range counts

      • rangeCount

        public long rangeCount(boolean exact,
              org.openrdf.model.Resource s,
              org.openrdf.model.URI p,
              org.openrdf.model.Value o,
              org.openrdf.model.Resource... c)
                throws Exception
        Perform a range count on the statement indices for a given triple (quad) pattern.

        Note: fast range counts are *fast*. They require two key probes into the indices. Exact range counts are only fast when the indices do not support isolation or fused views. Isolation is used if the namespace supports full read/write transactions. Fused views are used in scale-out to model shards and are also used in full read/write transaction support.

        Parameters:
        exact - if true then an exact range count is requested, otherwise a fast range count is requested.
        s - the subject (can be null)
        p - the predicate (can be null)
        o - the object (can be null)
        c - the context (can be null)
        Returns:
        the range count
        Throws:
        Exception
        See Also:
        Add REST API method for exact range counts , Resource... contexts not encoded/decoded according to openrdf semantics (REST API)

      • size

        public long size()
          throws Exception
        Perform a fast range count on the statement indices. This reports an estimate of the number of statements in the namespace. That estimate is exact unless the namespace is provisioned for full read/write transactions or the endpoint is scale-out.
        Returns:
        the range count (#of statements in the database).
        Throws:
        Exception

      • getContexts

        public Collection<org.openrdf.model.Resource> getContexts()
                                                   throws Exception
        Return a list of contexts in use in a remote quads database. FIXME This should be a streaming response for scalability. That will require us to change the return type for the method. E.g., to something that implements Closeable. Callers will then have to invoke Closeable.close() to avoid leaking resources. (This change could be made when making the CONTEXTS an operation that can be given a UUID for cancellation by the client.)
        Throws:
        Exception

      • update

        public long update(RemoteRepository.RemoveOp remove,
          RemoteRepository.AddOp add)
            throws Exception
        Perform an ACID update (delete+insert) per the semantics of the NanoSparqlServer.

        Currently, the only combination supported is delete by query with add by post (Iterable and File). You can embed statements you want to delete inside a construct query without a where clause.

        Parameters:
        remove - The RDF data to be removed.
        add - The RDF data to be added.
        Returns:
        The mutation count.
        Throws:
        Exception

      • update

        public long update(RemoteRepository.RemoveOp remove,
          RemoteRepository.AddOp add,
          UUID uuid)
            throws Exception
        Perform an ACID update

        There are two different patterns which are supported:

        UPDATE (DELETE statements selected by a QUERY plus INSERT statements from Request Body using PUT)
        Where query is a CONSTRUCT or DESCRIBE query.
        Note: The QUERY + DELETE operation is ACID.
        Note: You MAY specify a CONSTRUCT query with an empty WHERE clause in order to specify a set of statements to be removed without reference to statements already existing in the database.
        UPDATE (POST with Multi-Part Request Body)
        You can specify two sets of serialized statements - one to be removed and one to be added..
        Parameters:
        remove - The RDF data to be removed (either a collection of statements or a CONSTRUCT or DESCRIBE QUERY identifying the data to be deleted).
        add - The RDF data to be added (must be a collection of statements).
        Returns:
        The mutation count.
        Throws:
        Exception
        See Also:
        ://wiki.blazegraph.com/wiki/index.php/NanoSparqlServer#UPDATE_.28D ELETE_.2B_INSERT.29
